an8.53:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
an8.53:4.2: Then Mahāpajāpatī Gotamī went up to the Buddha,
an8.53:5.1: “Sir, may the Buddha please teach me Dharma in brief. When I’ve heard it, I’ll live alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and determined.”
an8.53:5.2: “Gotamī, you might know that certain things
an8.53:5.4: to being fettered, not to being unfettered;
an8.53:5.10: to being hard to look after, not being easy to look after. You should definitely bear in mind that these things are
an8.53:5.11: not the teaching, not the training, and not the Teacher’s instructions.
